params.param: Path of the working directory in the host.
Path of the temporary directory (relative to the working directory) where intermediate results files are generated.
params.flag: Use this flag to indicate that the intermediate results files in the temporary directory must not be removed. These files are removed only in the "after-remove-stop-codons" and "orthologs-reference-species" tasks.
params.param: Path of the input data directory (relative to the working directory).
Name of the reference genome file (i.e. the name of a file in the input_data_dir).
Optionally, the path of the global reference file (relative to the working directory). When this file is provided, the tasks "orthologs-reference-species" is executed.
BLAST type to use when finding orthologs.
Maximum number of tasks that can be run in parallel when running other Compi pipelines such as pss-fs or two-way-blast.
Version of the pegi3s/two-way-blast to use.
Version of the pegi3s/emboss to use.
Version of the pegi3s/utilities to use.
Version of the pegi3s/seqkit to use.
Version of the pegi3s/blast_utilities to use.
Version of the pegi3s/pss-fs to use.

tasks.task: mkdir -p ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir}/input cp ${working_dir}/${input_data_dir}/* ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir}/input cd ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir}/input sed -i "s/.>/_/g" * sed -i "s/[^a-zA-Z0-9>]/_/g" * while grep "__" ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir}/input/* > ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir}/dum do sed -i "s/__/_/g" * done rm ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir}/dum

docker run --rm \ -v ${host_working_dir}:/data \ pegi3s/emboss:${version_emboss} transeq \ -sequence /data/${temporary_dir}/input/${reference_file} \ -outseq /data/${temporary_dir}/translated_ref -trim
docker run --rm \ -v ${host_working_dir}:/data \ pegi3s/utilities:${version_utilities} fasta_remove_line_breaks \ /data/${temporary_dir}/translated_ref

mkdir -p ${working_dir}/orthologs cp ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir}/orthologs_clean/*.result ${working_dir}/orthologs find ${working_dir}/orthologs -type f -empty -delete if [ -z "${keep_temporary_dir}" ] then rm -rf ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir}/* fi

mkdir -p ${working_dir}/fast-screen/input
if [ -d ${working_dir}/files_to_re_run ] then cp ${working_dir}/files_to_re_run/* ${working_dir}/fast-screen/input sed -i 's/-//g' ${working_dir}/fast-screen/input/* docker run --rm \ -v ${host_working_dir}:${host_working_dir} \ pegi3s/utilities:${version_utilities} backup_file \ ${host_working_dir}/fast-screen/files_requiring_attention else # Copy only FASTA files with at least 4 sequences (the minimum required by FastScreen) for file in $(ls -A ${working_dir}/orthologs); do COUNT_SEQS=$(grep '>' ${working_dir}/orthologs/${file} | wc -l); if [ $COUNT_SEQS -ge 4 ]; then cp ${working_dir}/orthologs/${file} ${working_dir}/fast-screen/input/${file} fi done fi
mkdir -p ${working_dir}/fast-screen/logs docker run --rm \ -v ${host_working_dir}/fast-screen/:/working_dir \ pegi3s/pss-fs:${version_pss_fs} \ --logs /working_dir/logs \ --num-tasks ${compi_num_tasks}
rm -r ${working_dir}/fast-screen/input
# # Copy the files list in the fast-screen/files_requiring_attention file # to a files_to_re_run folder #
rm -rf ${working_dir}/files_to_re_run mkdir ${working_dir}/files_to_re_run
while read file do cp ${working_dir}/fast-screen/ali/$file ${working_dir}/files_to_re_run/$file done < ${working_dir}/fast-screen/files_requiring_attention
RERUN=$(find ${working_dir}/files_to_re_run/ -type f) if [ -z "${RERUN}" ] then rmdir ${working_dir}/files_to_re_run fi

if [ ! -f ${working_dir}/fast-screen/short_list ]; then echo "The "/fast-screen/short_list" file does not exist. Note that the "fast-screen" task must be executed before." exit 1 fi
rm -rf ${working_dir}/short_list_dir mkdir -p ${working_dir}/short_list_dir while read file do cp ${working_dir}/orthologs/$file ${working_dir}/short_list_dir/$file done < ${working_dir}/fast-screen/short_list

if [ ! -f ${working_dir}/fast-screen/short_list ]; then echo "The "/fast-screen/short_list" file does not exist. Note that the "fast-screen" task must be executed before." exit 1 fi
rm -f ${working_dir}/orthologous_gene_short_list rm -f ${working_dir}/orthologous_codeML_short_list rm -f ${working_dir}/orthologous_FUBAR_short_list rm -f ${working_dir}/orthologous_gene_list
cd ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir}/orthologs_ref_species/orthologs
for file in *.orthologs do grep ">" $file > temp1 tr "\n" "\t" < temp1 >> temp2 echo "" >> temp2 done
sed -i 's/>//g' temp2
cp ${working_dir}/fast-screen/short_list ./ cp ${working_dir}/fast-screen/codeML_short_list ./ cp ${working_dir}/fast-screen/FUBAR_short_list ./
sed -i 's/\.result//g' short_list sed -i 's/\.result//g' codeML_short_list sed -i 's/\.result//g' FUBAR_short_list
while read list do grep "$list" temp2 >> ${working_dir}/orthologous_gene_short_list done < short_list
while read list do grep "$list" temp2 >> ${working_dir}/orthologous_codeML_short_list done < codeML_short_list
while read list do grep "$list" temp2 >>${working_dir}/orthologous_FUBAR_short_list done < FUBAR_short_list
mv temp2 ${working_dir}/orthologous_gene_list
if [ -z "${keep_temporary_dir}" ] then rm -rf ${working_dir}/${temporary_dir} fi

metadata.task-description: Removes non-alphanumeric characters (with the exception of ">" at the beginning of a line) from sequence headers of the input files.
Pulls the necessary Docker images from the pegi3s/dockerfiles project.
Orthologous gene identification using the pegi3s/two-way-blast Compi-based Docker image. This task creates the orthologs datasets.
Translates the reference sequence using the pegi3s/emboss Docker image.
Split the translated reference to create one FASTA file for each sequence.
For each sequence of each orthologs dataset, finds the correct frame and make sequences multiple of three, using the "m3f1" script pegi3s/blast_utilities Docker image.
Filters each orthologs dataset to remove sequences containing in-frame stop codons or Nâ€™s using the "fasta_remove_sequences_with_in_frame_stops_or_n" script of the pegi3s/utilities Docker image.
Processes each one of the previous files to remove stop codons using the "batch_fasta_remove_stop_codons" script of the pegi3s/utilities Docker image.
Moves the files created in the previous step into a new location to be taken by the next step and removes the intermediate results files generated so far.
Runs the FastScreen image (pegi3s/pss-fs) using as input each one of the orthologs datasets. Only those files with at least 4 sequences are used to run FastScreen.
Copy the sequence files listed in the FastScreen short list (those that should be the subject of detailed analyses) into the "short_list_dir" directory.
Orthologous gene identification in the external reference species using the pegi3s/two-way-blast Compi-based Docker image.

For every gene list that is produced by FastScreen, performs the identification of orthologous genes in an external reference species (allowing cross-species comparisons), using the pegi3s/two-way-blast Compi-based Docker image.
